Author: zawy#5864
Content: I've been discussing with @jl777c how to do this.  Quick drops like this after hash attacks without symmetrical ability to increase causes too many coins to be issued, if the large miner wants to come back as soon as it is low again. BCH's asymmetrical EDA was a famously bad example and we're trying to do something 10,000x more extreme.   If you try to make it symmetrical with fast rises when the attacks begin, you end up in persistant wild oscillations as as the big miner comes and goes.   However this is an extreme situation where coins get stuck, so it's hard to imagine it being worse.   To test the theory this will issue too many coins, model for a 1000x miner to start mining if difficulty drops < 5x the  basiline miners' hashrate, and then stops when difficulty reaches 100x

Author: zawy#5864
Content: @dukeleto

Author: zawy#5864
Content: @radix42

Author: zawy#5864
Content: I guess the primary risk is causing problems for coins that were not at risk of getting stuck, opening a door for more profit, pulling an attacker into existence.

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: in theory, the CPU additive would reduce the large miner's ability to do "as much" damage (in what you're saying) because the chain keeps moving, which in turn stops the diff from reaching the mega-drop levels

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: It's not a "fix all", but it seems to me like a great additive for chains that have prolonged times of non-movement

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @zawy, currently debugging your latest suggestion

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: having to dig into the onchain DAA

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: about to start a small stranding test

Author: zawy#5864
Content: The problem is not that the difficulty drops too low, but that a big miner oscillates on and off without letting it drop back down to baseline..  A symmetrical DA will keep the correct average solvetime.  This kind of design is not supposed to.   I'm curious how bad it can get.   I'm posting to share a note of caution.   I'll probably be in private conversation with @jl777c for a few days.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think i am to where i can tweak whatever part of the DAA now

Author: zawy#5864
Content: I have not changed my mind on anything since our last conversation.  If you can send it through rigorous testing and it works OK, then great.  It will be nice if you can simply change the MTP =11 to MTP = 1  and everything works as I hope, fixing at least 2 things at once by changing only 1 byte

Author: zawy#5864
Content: Once out of sequence timestamps are prevented, the main dangers are oscillation and too many blocks issued per day.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, that is what we are testing. along with putting the actual diff onchain and removing the stepping, also FTL 4
